column4: hello all .. I need help .. I recently upgraded to Jaunty im a 64amd user .. but I have a broken package and I keep getting an error rgarding flashplugin-non free please check this output http://pastebin.com/d193fdc3a
can you open synaptic and choose fix broken packages from the menu then apply
its no biggy really you probably quit halfway through the install
: I did !! .. and it doesnt fix it :(
: flashpluging-non free is broken and the flashplugin-installer is not installed
does synaptic say its installed if so right click and choose full removal if not install it then do full removal
: I did try that too .. I cant even remove it :(
:Package is in a very bad inconsistent state - you should  reinstall it before attempting a removal.
: ok aside from this problem .. after the upgrade i dont have a wireless connection manager ( I used to use wicd ) but i cant even install it from synaptic :S
what you need to do is sudo dpkg --reconfigure -a I think if your having broken stuff
enable the repositories you use, some might be out of date and don't do 9.04
: ok what other wireless network managers I can use to connect :S? ..

wicd isn't bad, comes with default network manager. But I don't use either. wireless tools from command line such as iwlist and iwconfig etc are good. If you edit /etc/resolv.conf and /etc/network/interfaces you should be able to ifup your wireless
: this is the dpkg --reconfigure output I got http://pastebin.com/m30725298
no clue all I know is its something to do with using a dpkg command to fix it
: do u know anyone who can help me with that !
dpkg --configure -a try that
: nothing happened
did you try removing it fully and reinstalling it?
: flashplugin yes ! its too stubborn that it wont even be removed !!
hang on I'll check the package and tell you which directories it creates to delete it manually
